key_insight: VA-π introduces a lightweight post-training variational alignment that directly optimizes autoregressive token generators using pixel-space feedback, closing the gap between token-likelihood training and image reconstruction quality.
problem_solved: Autoregressive visual generators are trained to maximize token likelihood while tokenizers are trained to reconstruct pixels, causing a misalignment that yields token sequences decoding into low-quality images without pixel-level supervision.
method: Post-training variational policy alignment: treat the AR generator as a policy and align it to the tokenizer+decoder using a principled variational objective in pixel space.

Monte Carlo / sampling-based evaluation of decoded pixels from generated token sequences, computing a pixel-level loss (or evidence lower bound) and backpropagating updates to the AR model via a policy-gradient or reweighted likelihood estimator.
Lightweight plug-in design compatible with existing tokenizers and decoders — no need to retrain tokenizer, enabling practical improvements to generation quality after model training.
impact: Provides a practical technique to improve image fidelity of autoregressive generators with minimal compute and engineering overhead, enabling practitioners to reduce decoding artifacts and better align token-level models with pixel-level goals.
visual_elements: Pipeline diagram contrasting standard AR training (token-likelihood -> decode) vs VA-π loop (sample tokens -> decode to pixels -> pixel loss -> update AR).
Before/after image grid showing improvements in visual quality from vanilla AR to VA-π fine-tuned outputs.
Bar/line chart comparing metrics (e.g., FID, PSNR, or human preference) pre- and post-VA-π.
Icon set: tokenizer, AR model (policy), decoder (pixels), and a variational/policy update arrow to emphasize the feedback loop.
paper_title: VA-$π$: Variational Policy Alignment for Pixel-Aware Autoregressive Generation
paper_authors: Xinyao Liao, Qiyuan He, Kai Xu, Xiaoye Qu, Yicong Li
